e4: Adopting the new policy provides accurate and transparent financial reporting, upholding ethical standards and potentially reducing legal risks. Although adjustments in investor perceptions may occur initially, thorough communication and investor education regarding the change can build long-term trust and demonstrate ABC's commitment to integrity and compliance with financial regulations.
e5: An ethical reporting policy accurately reflects the company's financial reality without bias or manipulation, ensuring stakeholders are adequately informed. Transparency, honesty, consistency, and adherence to legal standards are crucial, alongside clear communication of any changes. The policy should seek to protect all shareholders, particularly less informed ones, and uphold long-term trust.
e6: Yes. I would ask management how we plan to explain the policy change to different types of investors to prevent misinterpretations. What steps will be taken to develop an effective communication strategy to transition smoothly, minimizing any initial market misunderstandings regarding reported earnings?
